query: What is cambridgeshire's total annual budget for the current financial year?

retrieved_documents.content:
[Page 6 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
6 www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk Spend in Cambridgeshire 
County Council 
on Adult Social Care 2023/24 
Annual expenditure across all services for 9,372 people for 2023/2024 was £258,000,000.00 
which can be seen in the following data which represents number of people and annual 
expenditure for each service area (figures are total numbers throughout the year). For the 
authority’s statutory returns, supported living beds are included in the data for community-
based services. The actual number of people in learning disability supported living services, 
(as opposed to residential) as of November 2024 is 621, at an annual cost of £55,165,546: 
Service Number of 
People Annual 
Expenditure 
Older People & Physical Disabilities Accommodation based 2177 £69m 
Older People & Physical Disabilities Community based 3473 £41m 
Physical Disabilities under 65 age Accommodation based 70 £3m 
Physical Disabilities under 65 age Community based 726 £10m

[Page 8 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
Household Support Fund data  
The Household Support Fund (HSF) was established by the previous government  
to provide a short-term boost to funding and mitigate the cost-of-living crisis. In  
Cambridgeshire this money has been used to support households experiencing  
immediate financial hardship, through the provision of financial vouchers or cash  
payments to help cover the cost of household energy bills and food. In the year  
from April 2024-March 2025, more than £3.6million was spent on free school meal  
holiday provisions, whilst more than £500,000 was split between Citizens Advice  
Bureau, Cambridgeshire Local Assistance Scheme, and Cambridgeshire ACRE.  
Cambridgeshire County Council’s quality of life survey 2024  
Whilst the quality of life survey results do not inform us directly about poverty, they  
do provide an indication of the attitudes and behaviours of Cambridgeshire  
residents towards current issues such as the cost-of-living crisis.

[Page 3 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
 
 
3 | Cambridgeshire County Council –  Paying for care - Easy Read | April  2025  
 Pictures  Words  
 The Financial Assessment works out how much 
you will pay.  
 
It also works out how much the council may pay towards your care and support.  
 The total amount of money needed to meet your agreed eligible  care and support needs is called a 
Personal Budget . 
 You can choose how to spend your Personal 
Budget , as long as  you spend it on things to help 
you with your agreed eligible care and support needs.  
 Your Personal Budget  can help you arrange 
support with activities whilst living at home like:  
 • washing and dressing  
• preparing drinks and meals  
• doing activities outside the home

[Page 3 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]

Payments for children in Cambridgeshire ) 
We will carry out a social care needs assessment , to find out what you want 
to achieve. We will then consider , with you , ways your needs could be best 
supported. This will be written down in a document called a Care and s up port 
plan . 
Personal budget  
We will identify a level of budget that is calculated to be enough to support 
your assessed and eligible needs as written in your care and support plan.   
This is called your Personal Budget. Your Personal Budget will be made up of 
the amount we financially assess you as being able to cover yourself (your 
client contribution) plus any contribution the Council might make.  
Example:  
We identify that your assessed and eligible needs can be met with £6,000 per 
year.  
Your financial assessment identifies your client contribution is £2,800 a year,  
Your Personal budget would be made up of your contribution of £2,800 and the council would contribute £3,200 a year, making the full personal budget

[Page 8 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
 
 
8 | Cambridgeshire County Council – Direct Payments  | April 2025  
 Personal Health Budgets  
A personal health budget is an amount of money to support your health and 
wellbeing needs, which is planned and agreed between you (or someone who 
represents you), and your local NHS team.  
You can find out more about personal health budgets on NHS.U K website . 
In Cambridgeshire, you can ask for information and advice on both Personal 
Health Budgets and Personal Budgets (including Direct Payments)  from 
Purple by contacting them  on cambridgeshire@purple -dpss.co.uk  or 01223 
679087  
Carers support  
If you are looking after someone, please see our Information on support for 
carers  w ebpages for help and advice.

[Page 8 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
 
 
8 | Cambridgeshire County Council – Direct Payments  | April 2025  
 Personal Health Budgets  
A personal health budget is an amount of money to support your health and 
wellbeing needs, which is planned and agreed between you (or someone who 
represents you), and your local NHS team.  
You can find out more about personal health budgets on NHS.U K website . 
In Cambridgeshire, you can ask for information and advice on both Personal

679087  
Carers support  
If you are looking after someone, please see our Information on support for 
carers  w ebpages for help and advice.

[Page 8 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
   
 
8 | Cambridgeshire County Council – Paying for care  | April  2025 
 More information 
If you want to find out more about paying for your care visit 
www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk  and search ‘paying for care’. 
 
If you choose not to complete the financial 
assessment  
You can choose not to complete a financial assessment or tell us about 
your financial circumstances. However, we will assume you can pay for 
the full cost of your care, and we will charge you that amount. If you 
don’t pay, we will take action to recover any outstanding charges owed 
to us.  
We can provide information about services and our assessment and 
charging processes. However, we cannot give you financial advice. We 
recommend that you take independent financial advice when making 
decisions.  
If you have a question or concern about your financial assessment,  
please contact us : 
Telephone: 0300 126 3003  
Financial Assessment Team  
Box No: SCO2205  
Room No: 2nd floor  
Scott House

answer:
The available documents don't provide specific information about Cambridgeshire's total annual budget for the current financial year. 

However, according to the Adult Social Care Market Position Statement, the annual expenditure for adult social care services in Cambridgeshire for the financial year 2023/2024 is **£258 million**. This budget covers services for 9,372 people across various service areas, including accommodation and community-based services for older people and those with physical disabilities.

For more detailed financial information or inquiries, you can visit the Cambridgeshire County Council's website at [www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk](https://www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk) or contact their Financial Assessment Team at 0300 126 3003.

test_metadata.prompt_template:
Please answer the following question about social care services in UK local authorities based only on the information in the provided documents.

Question: {query}

Context from relevant documents:
{context}

Instructions:
1. Provide a clear, direct answer that would help someone needing this information. If information isn't available, state: "The available documents don't provide specific information about [aspect]."

2. Synthesize information from ALL relevant documents to provide the most complete answer rather than analyzing documents individually.

3. Structure your response with:
   - A concise 1-2 sentence summary first
   - Relevant details organized in short, clear paragraphs
   - Bullet points for lists or step-by-step information
   - Bold text for key information the user should notice

4. For financial information:
   - Include exact figures, time periods, and what the funding covers
   - Present financial data clearly: "The adult social care budget is **£X million** for [time period]"

5. Always include practical next steps or resources:
   - Provide contact information, URLs, or application methods mentioned in the documents
   - Suggest where the person could find more information

6. When citing sources, use a simple format: "According to [document name/description]" or include URLs where available.

Answer:
